channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The car without front number plates but with the back ones has been abandoned blocking the public bins. The car is showing as SORN. It’s parked on the public area., 29th October
item.description:
Been there for a long time
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Witherston Way, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still no can or plastic recycling, 29th October
item.description:
I have reported this in the past and was told there are no resources to replace the broken Can/plastic recycling bin .. This was months ago and I appreciate there may not be funding .. BUT as this site is on the recycling centre entrance … there are currently 10 Paper & Cardboard bins but Zero for Pladtic /Cans .. why not convert 2 into tins & plastics and empty twice a week rather than the current once a week .. especially as the recycling centre is closed till 2026 and the bins are overflowing most weeks and many customers not knowing what to do just dispose of the tins and plastic in the glass recycling effectively contaminating the recycling…

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Baths Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Se9 3BF Garden waste left, 29th October
item.description:
The waste scratches passing cars. Please, kindly remove

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Witherston Way, Coldharbour, London

item.title: Totally blocked drain, 29th October
item.description:
This Drain has been totally blocked for months .. I did report months ago and was told it was fixed .. after heavy downpours like today the whole road fills up and sprays passers by

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hawthorne Road, Bickley, London

item.title: An oven has been dumped on the pavement outside 110 St Asaph Road, 29th October
item.description:

item.title: No safety guards pavement works, 29th October
item.description:
Work has been going on to isolate Finches burned out shop from services. There is a big hole left covered by plywood. The pavement is blocked with rubbish. It is impossible to walk past because of the cars parked on yellow lines. You need to walk into the ROAD to get past. But most important of all is that ALL STREET SAFETY SIGNS ETC HAVE BEEN REMOVED. A temporary pathway out in the road to allow pedestrians to pass the obstructions should be arranged with barriers and warning signs. This is URGENT.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25-27, Perry Vale, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
